_description: Spacing Configuration - Controls padding, margins, and gaps using a consistent 4px scale. Changes take effect after page reload.
_scale_info: Spacing scale in pixels using multiples of 4 for visual consistency. 0=none, 1=4px, 2=8px, etc. Use these values for padding, margin, and gap

scale._1: Extra small (4px). Used: Tight padding, subtle gaps
scale._2: Small (8px). Used: Button padding, compact layouts
scale._4: Medium (16px). Used: Section padding, comfortable spacing
scale._6: Large (24px). Used: Section gaps, large padding
scale._8: Extra large (32px). Used: Major section breaks, button padding (Tap to Load: 32px horizontal)
scale._10: XXL (40px). Used: Page margins, large separations
scale._12: XXXL (48px). Used: Hero section padding, major gaps

_components_info: Component-specific spacing overrides. Define custom padding/margin for specific UI elements

button._padding: Can be a single number or an object with x (horizontal) and y (vertical)

padding._x: Horizontal padding: scale[2] = 8px left and right
padding._y: Vertical padding: scale[1] = 4px top and bottom

modal._padding: Single value means same padding on all sides: scale[6] = 24px

_howToUse: In code, use useSpace(2) to get 8px, or useSpace(4) to get 16px. For component spacing, access via useSpacing().components.button.padding
_tips: Stick to the scale for visual consistency. Avoid arbitrary values like 13px or 27px. The 4px scale (4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24...) creates harmonious layouts
